H0.text: What name is given to the home of a beaver. Damhouse

H1.text: What name is given to the home of a beaver. Burrow

H2.text: What name is given to the home of a beaver. Hut

H3.text: What name is given to the home of a beaver. Lodge

A6.text: Beavers build lodges using tree branches, vegetation, rocks and mud.

A7.text: Without such material, or when lodges are not needed, beavers dig burrows into a bank to live.

A8.text: Once the dam has flooded enough area to the proper depth to form a protective moat for the lodge (often covering many acres), beavers begin construction of the lodge.

A9.text: In lakes, rivers and large streams with deep enough water, beavers may not build dams, and live in bank burrows and lodges.

A10.text: Dams restrict water flow, forming ponds, and lodges (usually built in ponds) serve as shelters.
